meanings.definition: Accept something reluctantly but without protest.
meanings.sent1: She was acquiescing to the new rules at work, even though she didn't like them.
meanings.sent2: The students were acquiescing to the teacher's instructions without arguing.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be acquiescing to wearing a tiny hat for the amusement of its owner.
meanings.sent4: The old tree was acquiescing to the strong winds, bending gracefully without breaking.
meanings.sent5: His acquiescing nod indicated his agreement, though his face remained expressionless.

meanings.sent1: The team members were acquiescing to the plan proposed by their leader.
meanings.sent2: She was acquiescing to the terms of the contract by signing it without hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was acquiescing to wearing the silly hat, much to the amusement of his siblings.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed smoothly, acquiescing to the curves of the land.
meanings.sent5: By acquiescing to the proposal, she showed her willingness to cooperate.

meanings.sent1: The employees were acquiescing to the new dress code by wearing the required attire.
meanings.sent2: He was acquiescing to his mother's request by cleaning his room without complaint.
meanings.sent3: The robot was acquiescing to the commands given by its programmer, moving efficiently.
meanings.sent4: The flowers were acquiescing to the sunlight, blooming beautifully in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The cat was acquiescing to the grooming session, purring contentedly as it was brushed.
